intro: Gynoxys heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. Its leaves are highly variable in size and shape, which is a notable botanical feature. Gynoxys heterophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
